This parameter must have the name of the web service.
It is the Payu ID (mihpayid) of the transaction.

This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash is mentioned below: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512 is the encryption method used here

executor_description: The Get Transaction Info API (get_transaction_info) can take input as the exact time in terms of minutes and seconds the output would be in the same format as get_Transaction_Details API output.

This parameter must have the name of the API command.
This parameter must contain the starting Time (from when the transaction details are needed) in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format
This parameter must contain the end Time (till when the transaction details are needed) in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format.

This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash as follows: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512 For more information, refer to API Authentication and Security.

The output consists of the status of the API (success or failed) and all the transaction details in an array format.

This parameter must have the name of the API command.
This parameter must contain the starting date (from when the transaction details are needed) in YYYY-MM-DD format.
This parameter must contain the end date (till when the transaction details are needed) in YYYY-MM-DD format.

This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash as follows: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512 For more information, refer to API Authentication and Security.

executor_description: Collect Payment API

value.description: The merchant key is provided by PayU and acts as a unique identifier for a specific merchant account in the PayU’s database. For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must always needs to be passed as:  7: This must be passed for SI.  10: This must be passed for Offers.
The transaction ID is the order reference number generated by the merchant to track a particular order. It can be used only once and PayU’s system does not accept a duplicate Transaction ID.
This parameter must contain the payment amount of the particular transaction. The amount must be greater than Rs. 8000 for the cardless EMI option.
This parameter must contain a brief description of the product.`
This parameter must contain the first name of the customer.

This parameter must contain the email ID of the customer. Note: This information is helpful when it comes to issues related to fraud detection and chargebacks. Hence, it is must to provide the correct information.

This parameter must contain the phone number of the customer. Note: This information is helpful when it comes to issues related to fraud detection and chargebacks. Hence, it is must to provide the correct information.
This parameter must contain the last name of the customer.
This parameter must contain first line of the billing address. Note: This field is mandatory for the cardless EMI option.
This parameter must contain second line of the billing address.
This parameter must contain the billing address city. Note: This field is mandatory for the cardless EMI option.
This parameter must contain the billing address state. Note: This field is mandatory for the cardless EMI option.
This parameter must contain the billing address country is mandatory for the cardless EMI option.
This parameter must contain the billing address zip code. Note: This field is mandatory for the cardless EMI option.
Success URL(surl) – This must contain the URL on which PayU will redirect the final response if the transaction is successful.
Failure URL (furl) – This must contain the URL on which PayU will redirect the final response in case of failure.
This field must contain the has and it is used to avoid the possibility of transaction tampering. For more information on hash generation process, refer to Encryption of Request.

This field must contain the payment category that the merchant wants the customer to see by default on the PayU’s payment page. If this field is empty, the system assumes the credit card payment option by default. The payment gateway value for each payment category is defined below. Example: if pg= ’NB’ then after redirection to PayU’s payment page, the Net Banking option would be opened by default. Refer to the following sections for integration with various payment modes:  Collect Payments with Net Banking  Collect Payments with Card  Collect Payment with UPI  Collect Payments with Wallet  Collect Payments with EMI  Collect Payments with BNPL

This field must contain the payment option. Each payment option is identified with a unique bank code at PayU. The merchant must post this parameter with the corresponding payment option’s(based on pg parameter) bank code value in it.  References:  For the list of test card numbers, cards for EMI, test UPI or Wallet, refer to Test Cards, UPI ID and Wallets.  For the list of bank codes used for various payment modes, refer to Bank and Card Codes for Integration.

executor_description: You can use this API to retrieve settlement details which the bank has to settle for you. The input is the date for which settlement details are required, where the var1 parameter is the date you want to know the settlement status or UTR (Unique Transaction Reference number). This API can be posted with version (1 or 2) in the var5 parameter.

value.description: This parameter must include the merchant key that is provided by PayU. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must contain the name of the web service.

This parameter must contain any of the following parameters:  Date for the settlement: Date for the settlement is required is in YYYY-MM-DD format.  UTR (Unique Transaction Reference number-alphanumeric) number: UTR of the transaction is required.
This parameter must contain the number of records in the specified page number is fetched.

This parameter must contain the number of records to be paginated on each page is specified in this parameter. Note: This parameter cannot be less than 10000 records.  For example, If there are 1,00,000 records to be fetched and if 20000 is specified in var3 and 1 in var2, this API will fetch first 20k records. Similarly, if the value 2 specified in var2, this API will fetch record between 20,001 and 40,000.
This parameter must contain either L or leave it blank.
This parameter must contain the version of the API that can be either 1 or 2.
This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash is mentioned below: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512

executor_description: The Get Issuing Bank Status API (getIssuingBankStatus) is used to help you handle the credit card or debit card issuing bank downtime.

value.description: This parameter must contain the merchant key that was provided by PayU. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must contain the API command name.
This parameter must contain the bank identification number (first 6 digits of a card).

This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash as follows: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) For more information on sha512, refer to API Authentication and Security.

executor_description: The Getting Issuing Bank Down Bins API (gettingIssuingBankDownBins) command is used to retrieve the card BINs for all the banks that are observing either full downtime or partial downtime at an instance.

value.description: This parameter contains the merchant key provided by PayU. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must contain the API command name.
This parameter must contain the bank name code (to be provided by PayU) or “default”.
This parameter must contain any of the following values:  0: to extract information about fully down BIN.  1: to extract information about partially down BIN

This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The following format is used for calculating the hash: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) For more information on sha512, refer to API Authentication and Security.

executor_description: The Get Net Banking Status API (getNetbankingStatus) is used to help you in handling the NetBanking Downtime. A few times, one or more Net Banking options may be facing downtime due to issues observed at the bank’s end. This API is used to tell the status of one or all the Net Banking options. The status can be either up or down. If you want to know the status of a specific Net Banking option, the input parameter should contain the corresponding ibibo_code. If you want to know the status of all the Net Banking options, the input parameter should contain the value as default.

value.description: This parameters must have the merchant key that was provided by PayU. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must have the name of the web service.

This parameter must contain any of the following  NetBanking code: Specify the NetBanking code is specified in this parameter to get status for the specific bank's NetBanking service. For a list of NetBanking codes, refer to NetBanking Code  default: Specify the value as default in this parameter to get the NetBanking status of all the banks (for the list of banks specified in NetBanking Code

This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The format used for calculating the hash as follows: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512 For more information on sha512, refer to API Authentication and Security.

executor_description: The UDF Update API is used to update the UDF1-UDF5 values of a transaction. UDFs are the user-defined fields which are posted from the merchant to PayU. This API is specifically used to update the values in these fields in the PayU database. The return parameters are the updated UDF values of the transaction.

value.description: Merchant key provided by PayU. For more information on checking your key and Salt, refer to Generate Merchant Key and Salt on PayUBiz Dashboard.
The API command for this API, that is, udf_update must be specified for this parameter.
This field must contain the transaction ID(txnid) of the transaction.
This field must contain the udf1 of transaction and must contains the Permanent Account Number of buyer.
This field must contain the udf3 of transaction and must contain the date of birth of the buyer in the DD-MM-YYYY format.
This field must contain the udf5 of transaction and must contain the Invoice ID or invoice number.
The hash is generated in the following format: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512

executor_description: The Invoice Upload API is used to collect Invoices or AWB from Cross-Border Payments merchants through upload from the Merchant Dashboard. Invoice ID and Invoice file will be passed by merchants selling software, whereas, for merchants selling goods, there will be separate requests for passing Invoice ID, Invoice file, and AWB number, AWB file.   The Invoice Upload API expects only the Invoice ID and Invoice file for merchants selling services. However, for merchants selling goods, different requests must be made to pass the Invoice ID and Invoice file, as well as AWB no. and AWB file; thus, the Invoice Upload API would need to be called twice.   Merchant calls the Invoice Upload API with the file to be uploaded, PayU ID (mihpayuid), and other mandatory parameters to access the info API.  For merchants who have to include the AWB details (AWB no. and AWB file), they need to use the Invoice Upload API as mentioned in the following subsections:  Including Single AWB Details Including Multiple AWB Details

value.description: Merchant key provided by PayU. For more information on checking your key and Salt, refer to Generate Merchant Key and Salt on PayUBiz Dashboard.
The API command for this API, that is, opgsp_upload_invoice_awb must be specified for this parameter.
(primaryKey) The PayU ID (mihpayuid) of the transaction must be specified in this field. The Invoice or AWB will be uploaded basis of the PayU ID.
(uniqueNumber) The invoice ID or AWB ID is specified in this parameter. Alphanumeric with special characters is allowed.
(uploadType) The type of document to be uploaded is specified in this field, and it can be any of the following:  Invoice  AWB

(attachment) The absolute path of the file to be uploaded is specified in this parameter. The maximum size supported is 2 MB and the following formats are supported:  PDF (.pdf)  Document (.doc or.docx)  Image (.jpg, .jpeg)   Note: The Merchant Dashboard supports only the .pdf and .docx formats.
The hash is generated in the following format: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512

executor_display_name: Get EMI Amount According to Interest API
executor_description: The Get EMI Amount According to Interest API (getEmiAmountAccordingToInterest) is used to get the EMI interest bank rates for all the enabled EMIs.

value.description: The merchant key provided by PayU.
The API command name is specified in this parameter.
The amount that must be converted to EMI.
The hash value generated by hash string.

executor_description: The Eligible Bin for EMI API (eligibleBinsForEMI) is used only when the merchant needs the EMI feature of PayU. If you are managing card details on your website, this API can tell the issuing bank of the card bin. It also provides the minimum eligible amount for a particular bank.

value.description: The merchant key provided by PayU.
The API command name is specified in this parameter. For this API, it is eligibleBinForEMI.

This parameter needs can include any of the following the values:  bin: If you want to check on the basis of the first 6/8/9 digits of card number or network token.  NET: If you want to check on the basis of network token.

This parameter can contain any of the following:  If bin used in var1 parameter, the first 6/8/9 digits of card number or network token.  If NET used in the var1 parameter, the entire network token must be passed.
This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash is mentioned below: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512

executor_description: The fetch_offers API fetches all active (with the Live status on Dashboard) offers for this Merchant ID.

value.description: The offer transaction amount
This field contains list of keys to filter the offer in an array format.
Unique reference ID for a transaction which is generated by merchant and sent in the request
This parameter is used to uniquely identify a user for a client/merchant.

The skusDetail is in an array format and contains the SKU offer details. For more information, refer to skusDetail Parameter Description. For more information on how to create a SKU offer, refer to Collect Payments with SKU-Based Offer using Merchant Hosted Checkout. Note: For product or SKU based offers, the value for the skudetail parameter needs to be sent.

executor_description: The validate_offer API validates the payment request against an offer key. This API doesn’t apply the offer and only validates the request.

value.description: The offer amount is passed to validate whether the offer is applicable.
You can use this parameter to pass the client ID value. Note: You need to pass client ID in the clientid parameter or merchant ID in the merchantid parameter.
You can use this parameter to pass the clientId or merchantId.

This parameter contains a flag to specify whether the offer can be automatically applied. It can contain any of the following:  True: If it is true, PayU will pick the offer from the offer keys and apply the offer.  False: If it is false, PayU will not automatically apply the offer. This is the default value.

This parameter contains a flag to specify whether the NCE offer needs to be validated. It can contain any of the following:  True: If it is true, PayU will not validate NCE offer.  False: If it is false or the value is not passed, the NCE offer is validated
Validate whether offerKey which are passed is valid.
This parameter is in a JSON format. For the details of fields, refer to the Description of paymentDetail JSON Fields.

executor_display_name: Cancel the Recurring Payment for Net Banking
executor_description: Cancel Recurring Payments API allows the merchants to cancel their Cards or Net Banking registration from their website. After the registration is canceled for a customer, the merchant cannot restore it, and the customer must register a fresh mandate with the merchant.

value.description: This parameter is the unique Merchant Key provided by PayU for your merchant account. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
For initiating a recurring transaction, “mandate_revoke” must be passed in this parameter.
This parameter is JSON parameter and description of the fields are described in the var1 JSON Fields Description table of this section.
512 SHA hash strings generated by encrypting request parameters so that any tampering can be avoided. hash = sha512(key|command|var1|SALT)

executor_description: All successful registration transactions are charged over the recurring interface with server-to-server API without any additional 2FA or the customers’ involvement.  This section describes how to achieve the Recurring Transaction for Net Banking, Cards, and UPI through the common platform.

value.description: This parameter is the unique Merchant Key provided by PayU for your merchant account. For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must contain “si_transaction” as value that is the command.
This parameter contains the 512 SHA hash strings generated by encrypting request parameters so that any tampering can be avoided.  hash = sha512(key|command|var1|SALT)

This parameter is constructed by combination of some mandatory and non- mandatory fields under JSON object.The description of fields in the JSON are described in the var1 JSON Fields Description table.  Note: Sequence of this parameter needs to be maintained as listed in the var1 JSON Fields Description table.

executor_description: The Pre-Debit Notification API allows the merchants to send a pre-debit notification to the customer regarding an upcoming payment which will be deducted from the customer’s account as part of the registration. There is a mandate to send this notification to the customer at least 48 hours before the actual debit, that is, 48 hours before calling the Recurring API.

value.description: This parameter is the unique Merchant Key provided by PayU for your merchant account. For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
The value of the parameter will be passed as “pre_debit_SI”
This variable is in JSON format and explained in the next table.
512 SHA hash strings generated by encrypting request parameters so that any tampering can be avoided. hash = sha512(key|command|var1|SALT)

executor_description: The Save Card BIN API helps you determine whether CVV needs to be collected from your customers and validated or not be collected for saved card transactions.

value.description: The date and time should be in the GMT time conversion(not the IST). For example, current time in India is 18:00:00 IST, the time in the date header should be 12:30:00 GMT.
Base 64 encode of (sha256 hash of the JSON data (post to server).

This field is in the following format: hmac username="smsplus", algorithm="hmac-sha256", headers="date digest", signature="CkGfgbho69uTMMOGU0mHWf+1CUAlIp3AjvsON9n9/E4=" Where the above format includes the following:  username: The merchant key of the merchant.  algorithm: This must have the value as hmac-sha256 that is used for this API  headers: This must have the value as date digest  signature: This must contain the hmacsha256 of (signing_string, merchant_secret), where:   signing_string: This is in the "Date"+"\n"+"Digest" format. Here, the Date and Digest is the same values in the fields listed in this table For example, "Thu, 17 Feb 2022 08:17:59 GMT""\n"+“vpGay5D/dmfoDupALPplYGucJAln9gS29g5Orn+8TC0=“  merchant_secret: The merchant Salt of the merchant. For more information on getting the merchant Salt, refer to Generate Merchant Key and Salt.   hmac username="smsplus", algorithm="hmac-sha256", headers="date digest", signature="zGmP5Zeqm1pxNa+d68DWfQFXhxoqf3st35
PHP uses cookie session IDs to keep track of sessions. This parameter must contain the list of PHPSESSID separated with semicolon (;).
This parameter contains the merchant ID provided by PayU
The Network Token BIN or the first 9-digits of the network token is posted in this parameter.

This parameter may contain any of the following:  True: Request the API to check if card CVV must be checked for the saved card transaction so that merchant need to validate the CVV accordingly.  False: Request the API not to check if card CVV need to be checked for the saved card transaction

executor_description: The BIN API or check_isDomestic API is used to detect whether a particular BIN number is international or domestic. It is also useful to determine:   card’s issuing bank card type such as, Visa, Master, etc., card category such as Credit/Debit, etc.  var1 is bin number which is the first 6 digits of a Credit/Debit card.

value.description: Merchant key provided by PayU. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must have the name of the web service.
This is the Card Number/Bin (First 6 digits of a card)

This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash is mentioned below: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512 is the encryption method used here

executor_description: The get BIN Info API or getBinInfo API is used to determine the following for a single card or multiple cards:   card’s issuing bank card type such as, Visa, Master, etc. card category such as Credit/Debit, etc.  cards with zero redirect support cards with SI support You can fetch cards details with the following specific feature-level information:  Complete BIN list having ATM PIN support is required Complete BIN list with OTP-on-the-fly support (IVR) is required When fetching multiple card details, you can limit the number of card details in the response using the start index and offset. For more information, refer to Multiple Card Details.  The following sections describe how to use the getBinInfo API for various scenarios:  Card Details with Zero Redirect Support Single Card Details Multiple Card Details Card Details with Standing Instructions Support

value.description: Merchant key provided by PayU. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must have the name of the web service. Specify getBINInfo for using this API.

Specify any of the following values in this field based on the output you required:  1: Specify this value if a single bin-level information is required. Output contains the information on a single bin only.  2: Specify this value if a specific feature-level information is required. Output would give the bin list.  3: Specify this value if all the bins and their information are required

The value specified in this parameter is based on any of the following var1 parameter value.  If var1 = 1, specify the bin number in the var2 parameter.  If var1 = 2, specify any of the following values:   1: Specify this value to get complete bin list having ATM PIN support is required  2: Specify this value to get complete bin list with OTP-on-the-fly support (IVR) is required
Specify the start index in this parameter. By default, the value will be set as 0.
The offset is specified in this field. This is useful when several card bins are returned and you can display number of bins per page based on the offset. By default, it is set as 100.

The parameter is used to check whether the Native OTP or SI is supported by the card. The is_zero_redirect_supported and is_si_supported parameters return the response for the following cases:  If var1=1 and var5=1, two extra parameters will be sent in response:   is_zero_redirect_supported  is_si_supported    If var1 is specified with the value as 2 or 3 and var5 is specified as 0 or 1, and the is_zero_redirect_supported and is_si_supported parameters will not return response   Note: The var2 parameter value needs to be posted according to the var1 parameter value.
This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash is mentioned below: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512

executor_description: To capture a pre-authorized payment, use the following command. After the API command is successful, the transaction would be captured and settled to you.

value.description: This parameter must contain the merchant key provided at the time of onboarding by PayU. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must contain the API command, that is, capture_transaction for this API.
This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash is mentioned below: sha512 (key|command|var1|salt)
This parameter must contain the payuId that was generated by PayU as part of pre-authorize operation.
This parameter contain the token, that is, merchant unique reference number. Character Limit-23
This parameter must contain the amount to be captured

executor_description: The check_balance API command is used to check the balance of a Sodexo card. When using Seamless Integration, integrate this API and display the balance on the Checkout page to your customers.

value.description: This parameters must contain the API command as check_balance.

This parameter must contain your merchant key shared by PayU during onboarding. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter contains the hash. Use the following hash generation format: key . '|' .command. '|' .var1. '|' .merchantSALT; merchantSalt
This parameter must contain the Sodexo Source ID in JSON format as provided in the example.

executor_display_name: Verify Payment Status by PayU ID
executor_description: The Check Payment (check_payment) API functions similar to the Verify Payment API. However, the input parameter in this API is the PayUID or mihpayuID generated at PayU’s Server unlike verify_payment API where the input parameter is the TxnID (Transaction ID generated at merchant’s server). It returns all the parameters for a given transaction.

value.description: Merchant key provided by PayU. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must have the name of the web service.
In this parameter, you need to pass the Payu id (mihpayid) of the transaction

This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash is mentioned below: sha512(key|command|var1|salt)  where sha512 is the encryption method used here

executor_display_name: Verify Payment Status by Transaction ID API
executor_description: The Verify Payment (verify_payment) API gives you the status of the transaction. PayU recommends using this API to reconcile with PayU’s database after you receive the response, where var1 is your transaction ID.

value.description: This parameter must contain the merchant key that is provided by PayU. Reference: For more information on how to generate the Key and Salt, refer to any of the following:  Production: Generate Production Merchant Key and Sat.  Test: Generate Test Merchant Key and Salt.
This parameter must contain the name of the web service.
In this parameter, you can put all the transaction IDs, that is, txnid (your transaction ID/order ID) values separated by pipe.

This parameter must contain the hash value to be calculated at your end. The string used for calculating the hash is in the following format: sha512(key|command|var1|salt) sha512 For more information, refer to API Authentication and Security.
